intro: Jacquemontia mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, night-blooming flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields. Its flowers are white to pale purple and emit a sweet fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. The vine-like stems and heart-shaped leaves are typical of the genus Jacquemontia.
